data.title: I Hate It But I Love It: 321: A Chorus Line
data.meta_description: It’s Musical Movie Month, and we’re kicking it off with A CHORUS LINE! We discuss a 2 intense performance by Michael Douglas, the world’s worst song ever written for a movie (or musical (or just in general?)), and we also talk about this movie’s love of cutting away to… nothing? data.text:
Hateful optimists and loving pessimists Kat Angus and Jocelyn Geddie break down movies and TV shows that they totally despise… but also really adore at the same time. With the occasional confused special guest! IHIBILI everyone.

Produced by Andrew Ivimey for the The From Superheroes Network.

Winner: Best Comedy Podcast (2019), Best Host in a Series (2020), People's Choice Award (2021), Canadian Podcast Awards.

Nominated: Best Television & Film Podcast (2019, 2020, 2021, 2022) and People's Choice Award for Best Podcast in Canada (2019), Canadian Podcast Awards.

Nominated: Best Television & Film Podcast (2021), The Podcast Awards.

It’s Musical Movie Month, and we’re kicking it off with A CHORUS LINE! We discuss a 2 intense performance by Michael Douglas, the world’s worst song ever written for a movie (or musical (or just in general?)), and we also talk about this movie’s love of cutting away to… nothing?

This episode brought to you in part by Rothy's. Rothy’s is the everyday flat for life on the go. It will blow your mind that they’re made from recycled plastic water bottles, because they’re the softest shoe you’ll put on your feet. We love our Rothy’s and know you will too! Visit Rothys.com/IHateit today for $20 off your first purchase.

This episode brought to you in part by ZocDoc. With Zocdoc, you can search for local doctors who take your insurance, read verified patient reviews and book an appointment, in-person or video chat.
